page.title: 03ODIHAM TOWN AND HIGH STREET
page.content: The primary land cover is intensively managed grassland. Hatchwood Farm on the A287, Farnham road, has dairy- cows, sheep, pigs and poultry. The secondary land cover is residential, consisting of houses, flats, shops and offices. These are on both sides of the High Street, which is the A287, Farnham road, and the B3016, the old London road. The Farnham by-pass was completed in 1979 and it relieves the High Street of heavy, goods vehicles, congestion and noise. Free parking facilities are available in the High Street and the Bury for shoppers. Along the High Street are some fine Tudor, Stuart and Georgian houses.The Vicarage and Palace Gate are two of the largest Tudor houses in the area. Above the shops are a number of flats. The George Hotel and the King's Arms are small, residential hotels.
